title: MySQLINSTR()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLINSTR()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Search for "3" in string ".com", and return position:
SELECT INSTR(".com", "3") AS MatchPosition;

Definition and Usage
The INSTR() function returns the position of the first occurrence of a string 
in another string.
This function performs a case-insensitive search.
Syntax
INSTR(
string1
,
string2
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string1
Required. The string that will be searched
string2
Required. The string to search for in
string1.
If
string2
is not found, this function returns 0
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Search for "COM" in string ".com", and return position:
SELECT INSTR(".com", "COM") AS MatchPosition;

Example
Search for "a" in CustomerName column, and return position:
SELECT INSTR(CustomerName, "a")
FROM Customers;

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLINSTR()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLINSTR()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLINSTR()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
